items.title: Goldman Demands an Oath From Junior Bankers to Fend Off Private Equity Poaching
items.description: (Bloomberg) -- Goldman Sachs Group Inc. plans to ask junior bankers to confirm their loyalty on a regular basis in a bid to limit advances from talent-hungry buyout firms.Most Read from BloombergSinger Akon’s Failed Futuristic City in Senegal Ends Up a $1 Billion ResortAre Tourists Ruining Europe? items.title: 'One Hell Of An Opportunity,' Fanatic's Business Training Camp Helps Professional Athletes Become Business Tycoons
items.description: Giving professional athletes the necessary tools to secure their financial futures through workshops on tech, entrepreneurship, and business was the primary goal of Fanatics' inaugural "Chapter: Next" career intensive. Nearly two dozen athletes attended the event, which was hosted by sports merchandiser Fanatics and sports media and entertainment company Boardroom. The three-day business training camp promised to "equip athletes and their associates with business skills needed for success beyond

items.title: Will Goldman (GS) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
items.description: Goldman (GS) has an impressive earnings surprise history and currently possesses the right combination of the two key ingredients for a likely beat in its next quarterly report.
